intro: Picralima laurifolia, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its fruit is a legume containing several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife.
